Description: Intact Attic black-glazed pottery salt cellar/bowl. Low rounded bowl of heavy build. Wholly painted save for an accidental line on one side and the outer part of the underside of the foot.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 237, no. 240)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 131, no. 367, pl. XXXIX)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1981)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5708 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
